util.objects.setDataStructures

Interface ISet

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Set_2LinkedList, Set_Array, Set_BitSet, Set_Copy, Set_Full, Set_LinkedList, Set_Std_2LinkedList, Set_Std_Array, Set_Std_BitSet, Set_Std_LinkedList, Set_Std_LinkedList_NoRecycling, Set_Std_Swap_Array, Set_Std_Swap_Hash, Set_Swap, Set_Swap_Array, Set_Swap_Hash, Set_Trail

    public interface ISet
extends Serializable
    Class representing a set of POSITIVE integers (typically graph nodes) Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
    Since:
    9 feb. 2011
    Author:
    chameau, Jean-Guillaume Fages

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(int element)
      Add element to the set Does not guaranty there is no duplications
      void clear()
      Remove all elements from the set
      boolean contain(int element)
      Test the existence of element in the set
      int getFirstElement() 
      int getMaxSize()
      Gets the maximum size of the set, or -1 if it is unbounded.
      int getNextElement()
      enables to iterate over the set

      should be used as follow :

      for(int i=getFirstElement(); i>=0; i = getNextElement()){ ... }

      The use of getFirstElement() is necessary to ensure a complete iteration

      WARNING cannot encapsulate two for loops (copy the set for that)
      SetType getSetType() 
      int getSize() 
      boolean isEmpty() 
      boolean remove(int element)
      Remove the first occurence of element from the set
      int[] toArray()
      Copies the set in an array if integers

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(int element)
        Add element to the set Does not guaranty there is no duplications
        Parameters:
        element -
        Returns:
        true iff element was not in the set and has been added

      • remove

        boolean remove(int element)
        Remove the first occurence of element from the set
        Parameters:
        element -
        Returns:
        true iff element was in the set and has been removed

      • contain

        boolean contain(int element)
        Test the existence of element in the set
        Parameters:
        element -
        Returns:
        true iff the set contains element

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true iff the set is empty

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the set

      • clear

        void clear()
        Remove all elements from the set

      • getFirstElement

        int getFirstElement()
        Returns:
        the first element of the set, -1 empty set

      • getNextElement

        int getNextElement()
        enables to iterate over the set

        should be used as follow :

        for(int i=getFirstElement(); i>=0; i = getNextElement()){ ... }

        The use of getFirstElement() is necessary to ensure a complete iteration

        WARNING cannot encapsulate two for loops (copy the set for that)

        Returns:
        the next element of the set

      • getSetType

        SetType getSetType()
        Returns:
        the implementation type of this set

      • toArray

        int[] toArray()
        Copies the set in an array if integers
        Returns:
        an array containing every integer of the set

      • getMaxSize

        int getMaxSize()
        Gets the maximum size of the set, or -1 if it is unbounded.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of the set, or -1 if it is unbounded
